question: 鈍い
sourceAnswer:
<read>にぶい</read>:: dull-(e.g.-a-knife)/blunt | thickheaded/obtuse/stupid | dull-(sound,-color,-etc.)/dim-(light) | slow/sluggish/inert/lethargic | insensitive/dull-(e.g.-reflexes)/unperceptive/unfeeling
<read>のろい</read>:: thickheaded/obtuse/stupid | slow/sluggish/inert/lethargic | indulgent-(esp.-to-the-opposite-sex)/doting
sourceMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an <ja>い</ja> on the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>dull</kanji>? It's <vocabulary>dull</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: To remember the reading, think about how when you're i<reading>neb</reading>riated (<ja>にぶ</ja>) you need to use a <vocabulary>dull</vocabulary> knife. The <ja>にぶい</ja> reading talks about a thing that is dull. For <ja>のろい</ja>, which refers to a dull mind (someone who's <vocabulary>thickheaded</vocabulary>). Think about a <reading>Nor</reading>se (<ja>のろ</ja>) God, the God of dullbrains.
